intro: Jobinia fontellana, commonly known as the Cape jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with simple, opposite leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in Mediterranean climates. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
